messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 448
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/25/2002 11:46:35 AM Pacific Daylight Time, ... I think they re pretty okay - not like airplaines, at least - get the ones that face each
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/25/2002 11:46:35 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> This 30 day pass with Amtrak seems like a good idea but its
> coach class so me and the spawn will be sitting upright for the 3
> days it takes to get to CA. Anyone know how comfortable those
> seats are?

I think they're pretty okay - not like airplaines, at least - get the ones
that face each other with a table between - The armrests come up - small
people can probably lay across two seats. The seat backs go back pretty far.
You can put your head on the table - more options. And on long trips there
are observation cars. Cool.

A couple of us moms folded origami for the couple of hours it took us on a
recent train ride between Orange County, CA and San Diego. The kids sat at
another table and played some kind of elaborate card and character game.

--pam
National Home Education Network
http://www.NHEN.org
Changing the Way the World Sees Homeschooling!
